%c[pda_white]Ashot%c[ui_gray_1] is Freedom's cheerful and optimistic trader at Yanov station.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
According to himself, because of his "low prices and quality equipment" he has supposedly been put on several hit-lists by black market traders.
 
He is a long-time buddy of an old stalker named Yar, and misses both him and the practical jokes they'd play on others greatly.

%c[pda_white]Axel%c[ui_gray_1] serves as a medic aboard the Skadovsk in Zaton.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Very little is known about Axel as he isn't the most talkative of stalkers, though rumours in circulation would suggest he only came to the Zone to escape from his mother-in-law.

The %c[pda_white]Barkeep%c[ui_gray_1] is the proprietor of the 100 Rads bar in Rostok.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Due to Rostok's central location in the busier parts of the Zone, the Barkeep is a very important trader - a lifeline for stalkers preparing for or returning from expeditions.
 
Aside from the obvious functions of managing the bar, he rents rooms, pays out bribes, and supplies stalkers with plenty of equipment and work.
 
He is respected greatly by many stalkers even today as he was instrumental in the opening of roads leading toward the centre of the Zone.

%c[pda_white]Beard%c[ui_gray_1] is an artefact dealer and barkeeper aboard the Skadovsk.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
He is a very important figure near the centre of the Zone and effectively the leader of the stalkers in Zaton.
 
Though mainly interested in artefact recovery he offers a variety of work, and he always appears willing to do whatever he sees as in the best interests of his people.
 
His bar is one of the busiest in the Zone - second only to the 100 Rads - and is almost synonymous with the Skadovsk itself.

%c[pda_white]Cardan%c[ui_gray_1] is an experienced technician and a recovering alcoholic.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
He came to the Zone with his two friends Joker and Barge, who after a fierce and booze-fuelled argument each decided to go their separate ways.
 
From here he took up residence at the Skadovsk where he proceeded to sink further into his alcoholism, only swearing off drinking when learning of his former friends' demise.
 
Prior to this he worked on the development of the so-called "Project 62", a prototype of the Gauss rifle, until its eventual closure in 2004.

%c[pda_white]Cold%c[ui_gray_1] helped restore and now leads the Clear Sky faction.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Formerly just the barkeeper, Cold is one of few in the Zone to have fallen upwards, taking Clear Sky's reins after most of its key members either died or deserted.
 
Known by his comrades as a cheerful and good-natured person as well as a lover of vulgar jokes, he came to the Zone because he could not seem to find his place in the outside world.
 
There is little doubt that he made the right decision, restoring his faction to its former glory and now occupying an important seat of power in the Zone.

The %c[pda_white]Doctor%c[ui_gray_1] is one of the few surviving members of Strelok's group.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
According to popular legend the Doctor was one of the first stalkers to reach the Wish Granter, with the desire to treat any living creature in the Zone.
 
His wish was granted and he was given the gift of healing, but his ability to distinguish between people and mutants was erased.
 
This is denied by the Doctor himself as just a story, saying that none of those who set out to find it have ever returned alive.
 
%c[pda_yellow]Trivia%c[ui_gray_1] 
・ He is one of the few stalkers to have ever successfully tamed a pseudodog.

%c[pda_white]Fanatic%c[ui_gray_1] earns his name from being a dedicated and aggressive stalker.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Following Wolf's temporary departure for the Army Warehouses, Fanatic took charge of the rookie village, looking after new arrivals on his own until his friend's return.
 
Despite no longer being solely in charge he is still regarded as an authority, though he much prefers to be out fighting bandits and mutants than standing idly by.

%c[pda_white]Gonta%c[ui_gray_1] is a professional mutant hunter and a pupil of Trapper.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
On the orders of Trapper he arrived to Zaton with Garmata, Crab, and Danila, to destroy a chimera which had been terrorising stalkers in the vicinity.
 
Right from the beginning their venture was struck by bad luck, with Danila mysteriously disappearing and leaving them a man short, and Crab being left bedridden after suffering injuries.
 
They hired a stalker named Magpie to assist them who instead backed out at the last moment, stealing their gear and then fleeing for Yanov station.
 
With the help of a mysterious stalker, Gonta killed the chimera, uncovered Danila's fate, and discovered Magpie's whereabouts - delivering him justice soon after.

%c[pda_white]Hawaiian%c[ui_gray_1] is the laid-back keeper of Yanov Station, and was formerly its sole trader.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Despite what his name would imply he isn't actually from Hawaii, but is nicknamed as such for often exclaiming "Aloha!" when greeting customers.
 
Almost all his time goes into manning the bar at the dining hall, formerly a ticket kiosk and waiting station respectively.
 
He has good relations with Freedom, and it is said his entire persona is to help keep the atmosphere light and friendly - both a necessity and a true challenge this close to Pripyat.

%c[pda_white]Professor Kalancha%c[ui_gray_1] is Clear Sky's head researcher and medic.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
One of the few remaining original members of Clear Sky, Kalancha spends his time conducting experiments on artefacts, studying mutant tissue samples and observing anomalies.
 
Described as a living encyclopedia and a calculator, he was forced into his position as a medic out of necessity rather than by choice. He is Clear Sky's most experienced medic following their near-collapse in late 2011.

%c[pda_white]Librarian%c[ui_gray_1] despite his name is actually Clear Sky's barkeeper.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
After the emission that cut the Swamps off from the rest of the Zone, Librarian found himself trapped with no easy way out.
 
Facing death at the hands of bandits or worse, he headed to the far southern reaches and joined Clear Sky, where he would later replace Cold as their barkeeper following the former's promotion to leader.

%c[pda_white]Lieutenant Kirilov%c[ui_gray_1] is one of the military's most gifted technicians.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Originally just a radio operator, Kirilov has always had a knack for taking things apart and putting them back together.
 
After the failure of Operation Fairway he and his group took refuge in an old laundromat where he harnessed his skills in repairing their equipment and weapons.
 
Following these events he was recommended by Colonel Kovalsky, his commander, to take up the role of being the military's foremost technician at their base in Agroprom.

%c[pda_white]Limpid%c[ui_gray_1] is a bandit and long-time technician.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Previously working at a factory as a mechanical engineer, it is fair to say that he is well versed in technology.
 
However after being fired from his job following a drunken brawl, he fell into alcoholism and eventually lost both his wife and his home shortly after.
 
With nothing left in life he sought out the Zone to start over, soon after meeting bandits at the Garbage and finding work as their technician ever since.

%c[pda_white]Loki%c[ui_gray_1] is the leader of Freedom's garrison at Yanov station.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
When the Brain Scorcher was disabled and the rush to the center of the Zone began, Loki was the man put in charge of Freedom's expedition.
 
Unlike other leaders in his faction he takes a more level-headed approach to their ideology, earning Freedom the respect of groups that may have otherwise been alienated.

%c[pda_white]Major Kuznetsov%c[ui_gray_1] is a callous and extremely corrupt military officer.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Since arriving in the Zone only a few years ago, Kuznetsov has risen from being a lowly checkpoint keeper to an experienced commander feared by his subordinates.
 
Despite holding little official power within command-and-control, he has bribed and backstabbed his way into a position where few of his peers are willing to oppose him.
 
As a result he has become the leader of the Zone's military forces in all but name.

%c[pda_white]Nimble%c[ui_gray_1] is a profiteer who sells smuggled weapons and outfits.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Starting out as a member of Clear Sky and then as a courier for Sidorovich, Nimble has assembled a list of important contacts allowing him to build his own smuggling business.
 
Unlike other traders in the Zone, he specialises in the sale of rare equipment and items that can be very difficult to obtain, as such he never knows what he'll get his hands on next.
 
He currently resides aboard the Skadovsk despite the resurging Monolith threat.


%c[pda_yellow]Trivia%c[ui_gray_1] 
・ Aside from his contacts in Clear Sky, a great deal of his gear comes from failed UN expeditions.

%c[pda_white]Novikov%c[ui_gray_1], also known as %c[pda_green]Grey%c[ui_gray_1], is Clear Sky's veteran technician.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
A member of the faction since their earliest days, Novikov is described by his comrades as an expert in his field, with Cold joking that he can make a rifle out of an empty can with ammo to boot.
 
After Clear Sky's destruction he briefly left to take up contract work with the Ecologists at the mobile science lab in Jupiter, but later returned after discovering they had pulled through and rebuilt.

%c[pda_white]Olivius%c[ui_gray_1] fences loot and other stolen goods for the bandits.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Capitalising on the chaos following the assassination of Borov, the former bandit leader, he quickly entrenched his influence within the Dark Valley.
 
Though he loathes placing himself in the spotlight for long, there is little in the way of information, contracts, or trade involving the faction that Olivius doesn't have his hands in.

%c[pda_white]Owl%c[ui_gray_1] is a blackmarket trader with questionable loyalties.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
An uncomfortable and rude person, of all the inhabitants aboard the Skadovsk he stands out as a bad character with a grumpy temper.
 
He has a rich assortment of weapons and ammunition, and very much appreciates any information which stalkers are willing to sell to him.
 
Because of his ties to Sultan, and both the manner of his speech and his appearance, many stalkers believe him to have once been a bandit.

%c[pda_white]Professor Kruglov%c[ui_gray_1] is a doctor of biological sciences.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Prior to arriving in the Zone, Kruglov studied pathogenic mutations in animals and their effects, so it was only a matter of time until his research brought him here.
 
For the last several years he has worked with his associate, Professor Sakharov, and claims to have made several major discoveries - though few stalkers actually know what he's talking about and usually just feign an understanding.
 
As of late he has taken to running his own research lab in a pod near the main bunker in Yantar, where he offers a variety of technical work to those who visit him.
 
%c[pda_yellow]Trivia%c[ui_gray_1] 
・ Kruglov is one of the few Ecologists to have survived Wolfhound's massacre. 
・ Although a third-rate fighter, he's still notably more adept at fighting than most Ecologists, especially given that he is firstly a scientist rather than a guard or former stalker.

%c[pda_white]Professor Sakharov%c[ui_gray_1] is one of the Zone's most veteran researchers.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
As the chief scientist at Yantar's mobile science lab, Sakharov is deeply involved in almost every scientific breakthrough to have originated from the Zone.
 
Although polite and professional, and despite his immense knowledge of many Zone phenomena, his sheltered position means he often underestimates the potential danger surrounding his field researchers.
 
However, because of the nature of his work - not to mention his personal success - he has an almost limitless supply of contracts to recover artefacts and mutant parts, making him a very popular employer amongst daring or foolhardy stalkers.

%c[pda_white]Sergeant Spooner%c[ui_gray_1] is an expert soldier and a cunning merchant.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Throughout much of his life information has always played an important factor in his decision making, choosing carefully what he shares and to whom he shares it with.
 
Naturally he found his place after joining the military where his skills are of great value, and now uses his position as a front for his personal trading and information broking business.
 
Very little information is otherwise known about him, least of all as to why he has such a peculiar nickname.

%c[pda_white]Sidorovich%c[ui_gray_1] trades out of an old bunker near the rookie village.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
He enjoys a reputation of being a fairly honest businessman who gives newcomers a chance to survive, whilst his wealth of contacts allows him to smuggle in luxury goods.
 
However many also see him as greedy and tight-fisted. Those who try to compete with him on his own territory, or just disgruntle him in general, often end up on the wrong side of an assassination contract.
 
Whether for good or bad, he continues to play an integral role within the Zone's economy and its factions' politics, as such he is a great source of work for those wanting to earn a quick payday.

%c[pda_white]Spore%c[ui_gray_1] is Clear Sky's trader and Nimble's trusted ally.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Like all stalkers before him Spore came to the Zone seeking his fortune, immediately setting to work smuggling goods and information to, from, and through the Zone.
 
Before long he caught the ears of Nimble who soon after requested a meet, and the two immediately realised the potency of combining their efforts.
 
Through Nimble's contacts within his former faction, Spore was soon installed as Clear Sky's trader, allowing them to secure smuggling routes through the marshes and quickly establish what would become a thriving business relationship.

%c[pda_white]Sultan%c[ui_gray_1] was formerly the leader of the Bandits in Zaton, and is currently the Bandit king of Dark Valley.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Considering his adoption of an eastern ruler's title for his name, many in the Zone consider Sultan to be a man who thinks very highly of himself.
 
His life has been one full of trouble; following the death of a close friend at the hands of substance abuse, Sultan killed the dealers responsible and was later imprisoned.
 
Following his release and his many other 'interactions' with the law, he eventually left for the Zone where he joined the bandits, climbed the career ladder among thieves, and began to run his gang.
 
Despite his enterprises being ruined in Zaton, he has nonetheless managed to impose his sense of order upon the Bandits of Dark Valley, who reluctantly conform to his worldview.
 
%c[pda_yellow]Trivia%c[ui_gray_1] 
・ Sultan and Olivius are known to occasionally butt heads. In the end, however, nothing comes of it due to both of them needing each other in order to maintain the gangs at Dark Valley.

%c[pda_white]Wolf%c[ui_gray_1] leads the defence of the rookie village.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Tasking himself with protecting the village and the stalkers that live there from outside threats, Wolf uses a network of scouts and spies to keep track of unfriendly movements that occur within the Cordon.
 
Sharing information he learns with Sidorovich, they frequently send out raiding parties and opportunists to clean out encroaching bandits, mutants, and other threats to their mutual interest in the village's security.
 
%c[pda_yellow]Trivia%c[ui_gray_1] 
・ Despite similarities in name, Wolf is of no relation to the ruthless Mercenary known as Wolfhound.

%c[pda_white]Xenotech%c[ui_gray_1] is a technician who repairs gear mostly for newbie stalkers.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Working out of the neutral base in the Cordon - situated about halfway between the ruined bridge and the "High Hopes" anomaly - Xenotech is a gifted technician whose efforts are of great value to stalkers new to the Zone.

%c[pda_white]Yar%c[ui_gray_1], also known as %c[pda_green]Uncle Yar%c[ui_gray_1], is a stalker with many talents.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
He is well known in the Zone for being a brilliant technician, with jokes that he can make an anti-aircraft gun from a rusty rifle perhaps not being all that far from the truth.
 
Following the end of the Faction Wars and the rush towards the center of the Zone, he travelled with Freedom's expedition to Yanov station, before very briefly working as a medic in the Outskirts.
 
He soon returned after the ceasefire with Duty broke down, where he decided yet again to change his profession and try his hand at becoming an information broker.

%c[pda_white]Spirit%c[ui_gray_1] is a former stalker and the Ecologist's local cook at the Yantar Mobile Lab.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
 Despite having served as part of the Iskra Scientific Research and Investigation Team for five years, he only became notable for making excellent omelettes. By 2018, he was moved to Yantar to become a part-time chef under Sakharov's request.
 
 Since the Monolith resurgence, however, he developed a weakness for alchohol, with Nemiroff Vodka being one of his more particular vices. While a bias for vodka is normal amongst Zone dwellers, his exceptional affinity for it has effectively barred him from being deployed in the field ever again.

%c[pda_white]Peregrine%c[ui_gray_1] is a part-time technician at the Mobile Lab in Yantar.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
An experienced soldier who served in the Ukrainian military. Three years ago, he earned great reputation after saving the lives of a team of scientists jumped by snorks while studying the Claw anomaly in Agroprom. 
Due to his considerable experience with technological equipment and anomaly detectors, Major Kuznetsov assigned him to the Mobile Lab in Yantar as per request from Professor Sakharov to assist the Ecologists and provide protection.

%c[pda_white]Butcher%c[ui_gray_1] is one of the most experienced mutant hunters in the Zone.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Unlike the majority of stalkers, Butcher is completely apathetic about artefacts. He, along with his group, simply saw the Zone as a new opportunity to pursue their love of hunting. 
Due to his famed skill at killing mutants, rookies occasionally gather at his shop to take advice or listen to his stories. Some say that he has killed at least one of every kind of mutant in the Zone. 
Although now a trader settled at the Garbage, his passion for hunting still shines through - he tends to sell quality hunting gear much cheaper than most, and is willing to reward stalkers well for bringing him meat and trophies from the Zone's various horrors.

%c[pda_white]Aslan%c[ui_gray_1] is a merchant who works with Dushman in Dead City.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
He works as the local Mercenary bartender at the Sports Centre. Aslan came to the Zone from Switzerland, the last place where he did hit jobs for a few clients. 
He keeps secrets even from people who know him fairly well, as he offers high rewards for different faction patches and nobody has any idea why he collects them.

%c[pda_white]Leopard%c[ui_gray_1] is an experienced Mercenary guide in Dead City.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Dead City was never safe, even for seasoned stalkers. Leopard is one of the very few who know the underground sewer network in Dead City. And for this reason, others rely on his knowledge to lead them safely within the city and beyond.

As his name suggests, %c[pda_white]Surgeon%c[ui_gray_1] works as a Mercenary medic in Dead City and can occasionally be found relaxing in Yantar.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Little is known about this man or where he came from. He proved himself after saving lives of many Mercenaries who were ambushed by Monolith troops coming from Limansk, thus earning the nickname.

%c[pda_white]Griffin%c[ui_gray_1] is the Syndicate's field officer on the Outskirts of Pripyat.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Assigned by Dushman, Griffin was tasked to eliminate local threats and take control of the area for the Syndicate. He had made considerable progress before the Monolith troops began flooding from Pripyat in large numbers, forcing Griffin's team to retreat and take shelter in a book store.

%c[pda_white]Trunk%c[ui_gray_1] is the Griffin team's technician on the Outskirts of Pripyat.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Trunk worked as a security guard for Triple Canopy in the USA a long time ago, before moving into the Zone. The Syndicate hired him for his long-term experience in the field and military equipment. 
He is a part of Griffin's team. He carries out repairs and maintains supplies with the help of Meeker.

%c[pda_white]Meeker%c[ui_gray_1] is a mercenary merchant who provides weapon supplies.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Having many connections with the outside world, Meeker is capable of transporting supplies of high-quality weapons for mercenaries in the Zone. He agreed to join Griffin's task force in Outskirts to provide them with necessary equipment to help fulfil their mission. 
%c[pda_yellow]Trivia%c[ui_gray_1] 
・ Prior to joining Griffin, Meeker was known to be a member of Strider's group. Some of his supplies imply correspondence is still maintained.

%c[pda_white]Leshiy%c[ui_gray_1] is a Freedom scout and part-time guide in Army Warehouses.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Leshiy is an energetic old man. He used to work as a Mercenary several years ago, before he met Lukash and joined Freedom, gaining a lot of experience in the Zone. He leads Freedom members through safe passages in the Truck Cemetery, and sometimes other remote locations. 
He earned a name for himself after saving his fellow Mercenaries from a space anomaly, and for being a cheerful person who guides rookies back to the Cordon.

%c[pda_white]Solid%c[ui_gray_1] is the Freedom medic in Army Warehouses.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Solid is known for two things: he has got quick hands, and he can treat wounds well. On the other hand, he is addicted to alcohol and drugs. 
According to him, they help him "focus". But that does not stop the occasional wounded Freedom member from getting scarred under his treatment.

%c[pda_white]Snitch%c[ui_gray_1] received his name for being a mysterious know-it-all stalker. Trades information in the Bar.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Taking a residence in the 100 Rads Bar, he sells all kind of information for stalkers who are willing to pay a high amount of cash.

%c[pda_white]Loris%c[ui_gray_1] is a merchant who sells all kinds of equipment for rookies at the Northern Farm in Cordon.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
He took residence at the Farm with the help of a group of stalkers who succeeded in pushing bandits out of the area. 
After settling his business with Sidorovich, Loris opened his supply shop shortly afterward. Since then, Clear Sky members visit him quite often to resupply because of the difficulties with reaching the southern part of the Cordon due to the military presence.

%c[pda_white]Hip%c[ui_gray_1] is a former Freedom member who took residence in the Rookie Village.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Hip has been in the Zone since the early days, but has so far lead a stalking life remarkable only for how quiet and reserved it is, very rarely venturing deep into the Zone even after all these years. The average stalker barely sees her as any better than a rookie, despite being dependable within her abilities. Recently, she has looked towards making key connections in an effort to rise up in the world.

%c[pda_white]Navigator%c[ui_gray_1] is an experienced stalker who works as a guide.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
With Duty relaxing the entry requirements to visit Rostok, Navigator quickly established himself as a guide able to lead stalkers almost anywhere from the safe confines of the 100 Rads Bar.

His friends refer to him as "that one angry merc". %c[pda_white]Vector%c[ui_gray_1] is both a scout and a supplier at Waste Processing Station in Zaton.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Vector is known for his bad attitude in general. Despite that, he is an experienced mercenary who offers a wide variety of weapons and guidance from Zaton to the Dead City. He and Leopard know the underground network in Dead City, and can lead their clients safely.

Little is know about %c[pda_white]Kolin%c[ui_gray_1], aside from the fact he is a skilled technician who knows a few tricks of the trade.\n \n%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] Kolin moved to the Waste Processing Station in Zaton along with Vector to provide assistance to the local mercs.

%c[pda_white]Eidolon%c[ui_gray_1] is a notorious champion of the Monolith.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
While most soldiers of the Monolith are expendable pawns, the one known as Eidolon is an infamous one-man-army who reactivated the Brain Scorcher, once again cutting off easy access to the heart of the Zone.
 
Legends say he silently stalks the streets of Pripyat, or spends his time in prayer, and that all stalkers who try to reach the Wish Granter are stopped short by his unerring intervention. His name comes from his legendary disregard for his own wounds, as well as his ability to appear from seemingly nowhere.

%c[pda_white]Gatekeeper%c[ui_gray_1] is an experienced Loner who defends the Barrier from the Monolith.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Following the deactivation of the Brain Scorcher in 2012, the stalker now known as Gatekeeper was one of the many who rushed to explore the heart of the Zone.
 
Years later he returned to the Army Warehouses, determined to hold the Barrier and protect the southern regions from the horrors he had witnessed there, as well as to stop the resurgent Monolith from expanding.

%c[pda_white]Rogue%c[ui_gray_1], a former soldier, is a tough-as-nails stalker.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Disappointed with his assignment in the Zone while curious about its nature, he eventually decided to abandon his outpost in Cordon to join the stalkers in the Rookie Village.
 
Having joined Strelok after years of accumulating experience in the Zone's centre, he provides heavy support in combat with his strict discipline, tactical acumen, and a light machine gun.

%c[pda_white]Stitch%c[ui_gray_1] is an experienced stalker who doubles as a medic.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Formerly a hospital nurse working in Kiev, the stories he'd hear from treating former stalkers would eventually convince Stitch to head to the Zone himself. It so happened that he later met Strelok not too far from Agroprom, and thus joined his new group.
 
Enthusiastic, cheerful, and laid-back, he helps his companions endure the harsh conditions of the Zone's centre with his sense of humour and medical proficiency.

%c[pda_white]Strelok%c[ui_gray_1], also known as the Marked One, is a resourceful veteran stalker.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
One of the most experienced and capable stalkers, Strelok is one of the few people who managed to reach the CNPP and live to tell the tale. He was also the one responsible for disabling the Brain Scorcher and opening the path to the heart of the Zone back in 2012.
 
Following a period of time spent as an official research advisor, he eventually abandoned his position and evidently returned to the Zone to undertake yet another dangerous journey.

%c[pda_white]Chernobog%c[ui_gray_1] is the Grandmaster of Sin.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
Former death row inmate turned into a Controller-like mutant as a result of top secret experimentation. He quietly established Sin shortly after the Zone was created and, when the C-Consciousness was believed to be destroyed by Strelok, took it upon himself to continue their work.
 
A charismatic leader and a visionary, he believes that the Zone is the means to cleanse the world from sin. In reality, however, he is a mad fanatic who is more than willing to fight fire with fire to fulfill his dreams.

%c[pda_white]Alexander Degtyarev%c[ui_gray_1] is an agent of the Security Service of Ukraine and operates somewhat apart from the rest of their armed forces in the Zone.
 
%c[pda_green]Information%c[ui_gray_1] 
An experienced military stalker and undercover agent, he completed many secret missions in the Zone. Rather surprisingly, he has also established excellent reputation among ordinary stalkers for his tendency to help them out.
 
Now that a massive emission has drawn the attention of the United Nations and their armed agents, Colonel Degtyarev launches Operation Afterglow to ensure that some of the Zone's greatest mysteries are not weaponized by international politicians.
